availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Pendleton Circuit Court
Clerks Office
June 13th 1865

King Plummer being in custody charged with the offence of Bigamy, and being admitted to Bail in the sum of Three hundred dollars, Now we. W. J. Myers. and Elizabeth Moore of Pendleton County Kentucky hereby undertake that the above named King Plummer will appear in the Pendleton Circuit Court on the 24th day of the present month to answer said charge and will at all times render himself amenable to th eorders and process of said Court in the prosecution of said charge and if convicted will render himself in execution thereof, or if he shall fail to perform either of these conditions that we will pay to the Commonwealth of Kentucky the sum of Three hundred dollars, Witness our hands this 22d day of April 1865
attest G B Dance C. P. C.

A Copy,
att, C A Wandelohr Clk.

Com'th
vs } Copy Bond
King Plummer
fee 30 cts
